climbs.name: Magic Carpet Ride aka One for Bill

content.description: Bolted by Eric Lewis Gentle slab start pushes a bit more vertical but remains slab until a small bulge with bucket jugs at the top of the climb. Stay to the right of most of the bolts until you pass the half way point. Traverse slightly left to climb on the left hand side, continuing past two more bolts below the bulge.
content.location: Right side of the Cryptic Wall.

content.description: A nice challenge for 11 climbers. Tends to stay wet for a while after a rain.
content.location: Around the corner about 100 ft past Acres Of 9.

climbs.name: Flash Mob
climbs.fa: Marcus Floyd, Dan Provasnik, Dan Rapp, Bill Weishaar

content.description: Flash Mob is bound to become a classic at Robinson. This left-facing dihedral starts as an easy stair step progression through 2nd class and 3rd class climbing to gain easy 5th class below the base of the beginning of the dihedral. Stay just left of the crack and follow the warm up holds to the next great rest. The inside corner (dihedral) features provide a layback stance, stemming moves, and perfect rest positions as you work your way up the climb. Just take your time, all of the holds are there.
content.location: Walk south past Bee Hive when approaching from the stairs. You can find this line on the right hand side of the Cryptic Wall following up an obvious, left-facing, dihedral corner.

content.description: Climb to the left of the bolts on small positive holds and enjoy the crux near the finish.
content.location: Just a little past Magic Carpet Ride

content.description: This is going to be a really nice route once it cleans up. It needs some traffic. You have a fairly high first bolt but an easy stairway on the right to get up to it.  After the 2nd bolt and then again at the top you need to pick left or right which will either make it easier or harder. Nice little hueco to stand in while you clip the anchors or clean. Make sure your belayer has a helmet.

*Note: We are currently cleaning this wall section. Please announce yourself while hiking and be aware of trail signs, posted warnings, and always wear a helmet.Cryptic Wall: This vertical white face has some variety in difficulty. The Cryptic Wall bolted lines are just south (Left) of the Bee Hive (Lilly Wall) and require a couple steps up, along the lower trail, to access base of the routes. The right side of the wall starts with an obvious left-facing dihedral which is bound to be a classic. The reddish hue of the rock face fades to white as you look left. The left side of the  wall section is bordered by the 3 Hour Tour Buttress.

Routes range from 60 ft to 75 ft tall and currently provide a slight range of difficulty levels (range from 5.7 to 5.11). Work in progress.

Ratings:

Currently 5.8 - 5.11 are offered with the range of line difficulties along this wall section. While easier climbs are given a rating number representing the climb to be no harder than the rating represented, routes rated 5.10 and up are given a specific max crux rating. This should help you plan your visit and navigate your way along the bluff while using Mountain Project.

Please provide feedback

using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.
